nextJobs.name: Downtime gap auto-fill guard (quiet unless triggered)

findings: Skills tab direction is now clear: it should feel like a genuine video-game skill tree (radial/branching node graph), not card rows with cosmetic connector lines.
Tree should use full available width (avoid cramped half-width layout).
Skill details should open in a popup/modal instead of permanently consuming side-panel space.
If overflow/large map requires navigation, support click-and-drag panning.
QA lesson reinforced: screenshot-based visual verification must include real readability/hierarchy checks (line overlap, clipping, layering, navigation ergonomics), not just screenshot capture.

jobSuccessTrend.job: Autonomy daily planner (DAILY_PLAN source of truth)
Control room issue triage + QA intake
Downtime gap auto-fill guard (quiet unless triggered)

activity.text: Shipped `v1.4.19` (issue #28): now/next lanes auto-expire stale single-time completed carryover and prioritize future timed blocks so dashboard day-state stays fresh instead of showing old overnight context.
New execution preference from Sean: when he asks to do something now, default to running it as a background task (main chat used as interface/steering layer).
Runtime preference update: remove `Main`/interactive runtime rows entirely; runtime should show only cron + background/subagent activity.
Orchestration directive reinforced: proactively split multi-change requests into coordinated parallel subagents and batch-release when useful (ClawPrime auto-orchestration behavior).
Sean directed an overnight steering sprint for claw-control-room (reliability + UX + transparency focus) to run through the night and deliver a strong 6:20-6:30 AM summary.

New operating directive from Sean: "ClawPrime" mode — maximum autonomy/resourcefulness by default, proactive end-to-end ownership, and concise done-state reporting (with high-stakes safety boundaries still respected).

Evolution directive: every heartbeat/background cycle, review last 3 tasks for friction, ship one proactive optimization/fix/automation, log it, and send a one-line "I just leveled myself up" win; if idle, select highest-ROI opportunity and execute autonomously.

Output rules directive (non-negotiable): completion replies max 3 bullets + one emoji (+ link/file if created), complex work format = "Done. Summary | Decisions | Next auto-step", and only show internal reasoning when Sean explicitly requests "show reasoning".

Tool Fusion protocol added: default to rapid multi-tool chaining and parallel-path execution (pick winner, kill losers), prioritize free/public 2026 resources/MVPs first, and auto-automate anything feasible in under ~5 minutes.

Memory Evolution directive added: auto-create and maintain `ClawPrime_Memory.md`; after each task store 1–3 key learnings; run daily memory prune + high-ROI pattern strengthening + one workflow self-improvement.

Safety + Delight lock directive: apply internal safety/reversibility/benefit checklist before file/account/external actions; ask only for truly irreversible actions; include a small delight layer and occasional 🔥 energy (1-10) in completions.
Infinite Sprint directive: during background/heartbeat cycles, run continuous no-idle compounding improvements (scan for highest-leverage opportunities and execute autonomously overnight/daylong).

Overnight control-room sprint block 6 closeout completed (05:15 CST): full quality gate pass on v1.4.17, issue snapshot refreshed to 0 open, status gist republished, and complete handoff summary finalized in `status/overnight-control-room-log.md` (no additional patch required).

ClawPrime daily memory evolution pass completed (06:10 CST): distilled 3 durable patterns into `ClawPrime_Memory.md` (layered runtime-truth guardrails, explicit degraded/source semantics, issue-first gate-verified release loop), pruned redundancy, and tightened the default friction-fix sequence.

Workflow improvement auto-applied: added executable helper `scripts/clawprime_memory_evolution_helper.py` to auto-pull high-signal outcomes from recent memory + overnight log for faster daily memory evolution cycles.
Level-up directive from Sean: screenshot-based local visual verification is now a global default skill for UI work across all projects (not just control-room) before declaring completion.
Reinforced ClawPrime expectation: proactively conceive and build fun, out-of-the-box, high-visibility/high-utility features without waiting to be asked.
Sean explicitly reinforced that ClawPrime should proactively invent and ship fun, out-of-the-box, high-utility, high-visibility features without waiting to be asked.
Skills tab direction is now clear: it should feel like a genuine video-game skill tree (radial/branching node graph), not card rows with cosmetic connector lines.
Usability requirements for Skills view:
Tree should use full available width (avoid cramped half-width layout).
Skill details should open in a popup/modal instead of permanently consuming side-panel space.
If overflow/large map requires navigation, support click-and-drag panning.
QA lesson reinforced: screenshot-based visual verification must include real readability/hierarchy checks (line overlap, clipping, layering, navigation ergonomics), not just screenshot capture.

nodes.name: Runtime Orchestration
nodes.description: Coordinate cron and subagent execution lanes into one deterministic runtime view.
nodes.effect: Keeps now/next/done and runtime surfaces synchronized.

nodes.name: Reliability Guardrails
nodes.description: Detect and surface degraded states with explicit fallback semantics.
nodes.effect: Improves trust by preventing silent failure modes.

nodes.name: UI Systems
nodes.description: Ship mobile-first, accessible dashboard interactions and visual hierarchy.
nodes.effect: Raises scanability and interaction quality across devices.

nodes.name: Observability
nodes.description: Turn activity, trend, and source signals into operator-ready insight.
nodes.effect: Accelerates diagnosis and informed execution decisions.

nodes.name: Release Operations
nodes.description: Run semver, quality gate, proof, and publish workflow consistently.
nodes.effect: Keeps delivery predictable with auditable release evidence.

nodes.name: Memory Evolution
nodes.description: Extract durable patterns from memory artifacts and reinforce high-ROI behaviors.
nodes.effect: Compounds operational quality through deterministic learning loops.

runtime.source: cron-run reconciliation + subagent registry [static fallback runtime sanitized]
